title: Sydney Penthouse Sale Sets New Record in Australia at A$140 Million
text:
The nine-figure sale of multiple floors at the top of a Renzo Piano-designed development in Sydney has smashed Australian real estate records and become the most expensive residence sold in the country.



The three-floor spread changed hands in an off-market deal for upwards of A$140 million (US$96.09 million) to a local buyer, according to a news release from developer Lendlease, released Saturday.



Mansion Global could not confirm the exact sale price or the identity of the buyer.

The sale comprises a duplex penthouse and an accompanying single-floor penthouse apartment spanning the top floors of the tallest tower in the under-construction One Sydney Harbour project.



The development, reportedly set for completion in 2023, is a collection of three luxury residential buildings designed by the Pritzker Prize-winning architect in Sydney’s Barangaroo area on the northwestern shore of the city’s central business district.



Together, the residences will have nine bedrooms, with more than 17,200 square feet of living space, a private rooftop pool, a spa, a gym and a master bedroom that is “bigger than most homes,” the release said.



From Penta: 20 Minutes With: Billionaire Investor, Conservationist Thomas Kaplan

“The sale of the penthouse at One Sydney Harbour is a paradigm shift for the Australian property market with an apartment claiming the title of Australia’s most valuable residential property for the first time, a title historically reserved for significant houses,” Kylie Rampa, CEO of property at Lendlease, said in the release.



“Demand for residences throughout the tower has been extremely high, attracting strong local and global interest,” Ms. Rampa said.



The transaction took the mantle of Australia’s most expensive home from “Fairwater,” the historic waterfront estate in Sydney that sold to tech billionaire Mike Cannon-Brookes last year for A$100 million.
